info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 12:07PM EDT until April 6 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sycamore Creek At Holt affecting Ingham County.
Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County.
Portage River near Vicksburg affecting Kalamazoo County.
.Additional rainfall from one quarter to one half inch is expected tonight. This isn't expected to worsen the flooding but will slow the fall on the rivers.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sycamore Creek at Holt.
* WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to the river, in the Lansing Municipal Golf Course and sections of East Mt. Hope Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Friday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 4.5 feet Friday, April 11. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.4 feet on 04/20/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
